commit.message:
Standardize log slugs and log levels

Adds a mechanism to set a global log level. Configuring Amplify with:

  Amplify.addPlugin(new AndroidLoggingPlugin(LogLevel.VERBOSE))

Will cause any new Loggers to use LogLevel.VERBOSE as the default log
level.

Additionally, transitions the codebase to use

  LoggingCategoryBehavior#forCategory(CategoryType)

Instead of:

  LoggingCategoryBehavior#forNamespace(String).

nodes.bodyText: This drops the aws- prefix from the log slugs, which doesn't necessarily seem wrong to me, but did spark the thought that is there a reason for individual plugins to differentiate themselves? (say, for instance, you're using the aws-analytics-pinpoint plugin and the foo-analytics-bar plugin, for example.
This is an interesting one as there will be routinely two plugins -- aws-predictions and aws-predictions-tensorflow running concurrently.
Huh. I guess it stands to reason that DataStore would lowercase to data-store, but I hadn't seen it before.
